parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method controls access via authentication .

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The search keywords. (optional)

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted. (optional)

parameters.name: count_only
parameters.description: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result. (optional)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The desired number of results per "page". (optional)

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The desired "page" number. (optional)

parameters.name: within
parameters.description: If within is set and the "location" parameter resolves to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified radius. If the "location" parameter does not resolve to a specific location, this parameter is ignored. (optional)

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi". (optional)

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: One of 'popularity', 'relevance', or 'venue_name'. Default is 'relevance'. (optional)

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default varies by sort_order. (optional)

realresponses.200:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<error string="Missing parameter">
  <description>Either the 'keywords' or 'location' parameter is required.</description>
</error>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<error string="Authentication error">
  <description>You are not authorized. The most likely reason is you have not included Oauth parameters or the interface library you are using has not been updated for Oauth yet.<br>The Oauth library returns this error.<br>Missing required parameter, "oauth_consumer_key"</description>
</error>

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method controls access via authentication . Oauth is NOT needed but an application key (app_key query string parameter) is required.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The search keywords. (optional)

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted, as are postal codes ("92122") and venue IDs ("V0-001-000268633-5"). Common geocoordinate formats ("32.746682, -117.162741") are also accepted, but the "within" parameter is required in order to set a search radius. (optional)

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Limit this list of results to a date range, specified by label or exact range. Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g. "October". Exact ranges can be specified the form 'YYYYMMDD00-YYYYMMDD00', for example '2012042500-2012042700'; the last two digits of each date in this format are ignored. (optional)

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Limit the search results to this category ID. A list of categories may be specified separated by commas. See /categories/list for a list of categories and their IDs. (optional)

parameters.name: ex_category
parameters.description: Exclude search results from including this category ID. A list of categories may be specified separated by commas. See /categories/list for a list of categories and their IDs. (optional)

parameters.name: within
parameters.description: If within is set and the "location" parameter resolves to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified radius. If the "location" parameter does not resolve to a specific location, this parameter is ignored. (optional)

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi". (optional)

parameters.name: count_only
parameters.description: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result. (optional)

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: One of 'popularity', 'date', or 'relevance'. Default is 'relevance'. (optional)

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default varies by sort_order. (optional)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The desired number of results per page. (optional)

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The desired page number. (optional)

parameters.name: image_sizes
parameters.description: A comma separted list of image_sizes desired. See Faq for list of possible image sizes. (optional)

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: Return our guess of each event language. ("Undetermined" is a possibility) (optional)

parameters.name: mature
parameters.description: Sets the level of filtering for events marked as "mature" due to keywords in the title or description. One of 'all' (no filtering), 'normal', or 'safe'. 'Normal' mature filtering consists of words that are clearly profanities and inappropriate for younger audiences. 'Safe' mature filtering consists of all normal mature filtered words, as well as other terms that may be used as inappropriate innuendo. A 'safe' filter may eliminate events that are benign in nature, but contain questionable content based on keywords. Defaults to 'all'. (optional)

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Indicates that optional sections should be included in the result XML. Multiple section names can be indicated, separated by commas (e.g. 'categories,links'). Sections include 'categories', 'subcategories', 'popularity', 'tickets', 'price', and 'links'. (optional)

parameters.name: change_multi_day_start
parameters.description: If set changes the start_date of long duration events (lasting multiple days) to the beginning of the search date range. It will also give the next occurence of a recurring event after the start range. This will prevent an event from appearing to be outside the date range requested . (optional)

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method controls access via authentication .

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The search keywords. (optional)

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted, as are postal codes ("92122"). Full addresses ("1 Infinite Loop, Cupertino, CA") and common geocoordinate formats ("32.746682, -117.162741") are also accepted, but the "within" parameter is recommended in order to set a search radius. (optional)

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Limit this list of results to the specified date range. Date ranges are specified by label. Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g. "October". (optional)

parameters.name: within
parameters.description: If within is set and the "location" parameter resolves to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified radius. If the "location" parameter does not resolve to a specific location, this parameter is ignored. (optional)

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi". (optional)

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: One of 'popularity', 'date', 'title', 'relevance', or 'venue_name'. Default is 'date'. (optional)

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default varies by sort_order. (optional)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The desired number of results per page. Default: 50, Maximum: 50. (optional)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Summary of search query passed from input parameters.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: Source of RSS feed. (http://eventful.com/)

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Required by RSS 2.0 format.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Default "en-US".

parameters.name: copyright
parameters.description: Required by RSS 2.0 format.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Required by RSS 2.0 format.

parameters.name: generator
parameters.description: Required by RSS 2.0 format.

parameters.name: docs
parameters.description: Required by RSS 2.0 format.

parameters.name: ttl
parameters.description: Required by RSS 2.0 format.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Each item entry has the following structure: title string The event title. description string The event description. In RSS, this includes the start time, end time, venue, venueid, tags, and description. category string Unused. pubDate string The start date and time of the event. (e.g. "Mon, 26 Sep 2005 08:33:28 -0700") guid string The unique ID for this event, it is the event's Eventful URL. link string URL of associated event on Eventful site.

parameters.description: The ID of the venue to which this comment is being added.

parameters.description: The body of the comment message.

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires the usual authentication arguments.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The search keywords.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Orders sorting of results by "relevance" (default), "username", "event_count", "venue_count", or "calendar_count".

parameters.name: count_only
parameters.description: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The desired number of results per "page".

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The desired "page" number.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<event id="E0-001-000213902-2">
  <tags>
    <tag id="conference">
      <title>conference</title>
      <owner></owner>
    </tag>
    <tag id="mars">
      <title>mars</title>
      <owner></owner>
    </tag>
    <tag id="marssociety">
      <title>Mars Society</title>
      <owner></owner>
    </tag>
  </tags>
</event>

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires the usual authentication arguments.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A space-delimited list of tags. Tags with spaces should be enclosed in quotes (e.g. "San Diego").

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event to which these tags are being added.

</error>

<venue id="V0-001-000327040-5">
  <tags>
    <tag id="campus">
      <title>campus</title>
      <owner>anthony760</owner>
    </tag>
    <tag id="college">
      <title>college</title>
      <owner>anthony760</owner>
    </tag>
    <tag id="cuv">
      <title>cuv</title>
      <owner>anthony760</owner>
    </tag>
    <tag id="education">
      <title>education</title>
      <owner>anthony760</owner>
    </tag>
    <tag id="school">
      <title>school</title>
      <owner>anthony760</owner>
    </tag>
    <tag id="university">
      <title>university</title>
      <owner>chuck</owner>
    </tag>
  </tags>
</venue>

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The event ID to modify.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The event title. (optional)

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: The event start time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. "2005-03-01 19:00:00"). (optional)

parameters.name: stop_time
parameters.description: The event stop time, if any, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. "2005-03-01 19:00:00"). (optional)

parameters.name: tz_olson_path
parameters.description: The event timezone, as listed in the Olson timezones database (e.g. "America/New_York") (optional)

parameters.name: all_day
parameters.description: True ("1") if the event is an all-day event, false ("0") otherwise. (optional)

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The event description. (optional)

parameters.name: privacy
parameters.description: The privacy setting for this event. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private) (optional)

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A space-delimited list of tags. (optional)

parameters.name: free
parameters.description: True ("1") if the event is free, false ("0") otherwise. (optional)

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: A text string describing the event price. For example, this could indicate a price range ("$15 - $35"), free but donations requested ("$10 donation suggested"), or other special instructions ("Adults $15, children under eight $5"). Don't pass this parameter or leave it blank if there is no price information. (optional)

parameters.name: venue_id
parameters.description: The ID of the venue where this event occurs. Use /venues/new or /venues/search retrieve an appropriate ID. (optional)

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: The ID of this event's parent event. If empty, removes the parent event. (optional)

</error>

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the performer.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The page_size (number of events) to be returned (defaults to 10).

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The page number of events to be returned (defaults to 1) .

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The displayed name for this venue.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The street address of the venue. (optional)

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city name. (optional)

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The name of the region (state, province, county) (optional)

parameters.name: postal_code
parameters.description: The postal code or ZIP code. (optional)

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The name of the country.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The venue description. (optional)

parameters.name: privacy
parameters.description: The privacy setting for this venue. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private) (optional, defaults to 1)

parameters.name: venue_type
parameters.description: The type of venue (e.g. Cinema, Arena). See the new venue page for a current list of options.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: A URI link to further information about this venue. (optional)

parameters.name: url_type
parameters.description: The type of the link provided in the url parameter (e.g. Blog, Review, Official Site). See the "Add a link" section of any event page for a current list. (optional)

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: The ID of this venue's parent venue. (optional)
